section.title: Description
section.p: The release of a patient from a course of care.

stentry.p: "This field contains the discharge date/time. It is to be used if the event date/time is different than the discharge date and time, that is, a retroactive update. This field is also used to reflect the date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient discharge." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-45
See Discharge Disposition (HL7) definition for values.

"Contains the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.). ...use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-36 Note that while the encounter is still "active" (i.e., the encounter does not have an end date yet) this attribute should be interpreted as the expected discharge disposition. When the encounter is "completed" this attribute contains the actual discharge disposition.
The diagnosis(es) determined to be the reason for hospitalization at the time of discharge (this may be the same or different from the hospital admission diagnosis (added for Transition of Care).

"The location to which the patient is assigned. It is a role played by a place at which services may be provided. Note that a single physical place can play multiple service delivery location roles each with its own attributes. For example, a Podiatry clinic and Research clinic may meet on alternate days in the same physical location; each clinic uses its own mailing address and telephone number." (HL7)

Pointer to a Patient Education record which documents the Act of the provision of instructions to the Patient upon the completion of an Encounter. These instructions may be in the form of a pre-defined document that is specific to the Patient's condition or the Procedure which has undergone, or it may be in the form of free-form text, or both. We point to the Patient Education class rather than simply having a discharge instructions string property so that data can be collected regarding who provided the instructions and when, as well as an indication of the patient's level of understanding.
"Indicates the healthcare facility to which the patient was discharged and the date." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-37
